reviews.title: Good food and super cozy location
reviews.text: Amazingly good food in this cozy Cafe Restaurant on the Noorderhaven. Friendly service and good portions on your plate.

reviews.title: I'd love to go again!
reviews.text:
The appetizer plate with cold and warm treats is sensational and hardly manageable for two! 
Service and ambience top , you sit both outside and inside beautifully.

reviews.title: Good.
reviews.text:
Pleasant sitting by the water. 
Fast and friendly service. 
Basic, but good food. 
You can also go here if you just want a drink.

reviews.title: Nice place
reviews.text: You'll be comfortable here and you'll feel welcome. Nice and very friendly service. Beautiful view and the food was delicious, great!

reviews.title: Good food and good location
reviews.text: Good restaurant if the weather is nice: you can sit outside next to the water. Food is unpretentious and tasty.

reviews.title: A scallop starter that I went back for!
reviews.text:
We were in Harlingen for four nights and ate a light meal here on the first night.  My husband had the mustard soup (he says it was warming and delicious), while I had the scallops starter, which came with toast.  It was one of the nicest scallop dishes I have ever had.  

We enjoyed that little meal so much that we went back for the full three courses each on our last night.  Needless to say I had the scallops again, along with the Dorade and a meringue type dessert - hubby had veal as his main course.  Loved it.  Friendly, efficient staff and really nice sea-faring pub atmosphere.  We'd absolutely recommend it.

reviews.title: Not a bad curry to be fair
reviews.text:
I do like good curry and as there are no Indian restaurants in these parts it’s hard to come by.
This curry was a satisfying alternative not exactly Indian style and quite mild but nice all the same.  Nice bar good food and the beer has improved from when I last visited.

reviews.title: Lovely Pub Atmosphere and the food is good
reviews.text:
If you are wanting to experience a Pub atmosphere this is the place for you. Well located in the Port of Harlingen you can sit outside and watch the boats both large and small juxtaposition themselves for a precious sought after mooring whilst sipping the golden amber or having a gin and tonic - no pressure with this activity!
The food is quite good and the serving sizes are very ample. A great place to catch up with friends and have a fun night.

reviews.title: Good fish.
reviews.text: Not too busy and so service was very good.  We ate a mixture of fish and meat, all very good but especially the fish.  A variety of beers.  Good location.

reviews.title: nice atmosphere, food just ok
reviews.text:
nice place at the harbor, good for boaties 
nice terrace and friendly staff
however, don’t expect too much from the food despite many positive reviews
we had their seasonal specialty ‘asperges’ 
which were 5 very thin specimen, the accompanying meat (lambs neck) and fish was ok, but sauces came directly from a bottle or powder .... which I found especially disturbing with the sauce Hollandaise.

however, friendly service, good location, might come back for a beer in the terrace.

reviews.title: Nice atmosphere, with some superb but also some average food
reviews.text:
The folks here are always welcoming, with good service -- especially compared to most other Dutch restaurants, but even stacking up to international standards.

Some of the food is really very good, especially the pea soup ("erwtensoep") which is a Dutch traditional. I have never had better in my life. The owner makes this himself, not the cook, I believe. 

Unfortunately, most of the menu is quite unadventurous and somewhat average in execution. It's not bad at all, and I have never eaten something really disappointing here, but it is just a bit bland.

reviews.title: Table for four, and we all ordered fish....
reviews.text: We came in and were promptly seated. Service was excellent, and we had a really good dinner. The fish fillets were substantial in size, well prepared and came with a nice assortment of side dishes. We were quite pleased.with our meal.

reviews.title: Nice Lunch
reviews.text: We were in Harlingen on a personal tour to discover family roots since our ancestors immigrated from Harlingen in 1840's.  We stopped at this cafe for lunch and found the proprietors warm, friendly, welcoming and willing to speak English with no prompting. My wife had a herring dish which had nice presentation and she enjoyed very much.  Our guide had the salmon sandwich which was presented well and he enjoyed. I had onion soup and found it wonderful.  The facility was clean and very interesting to observe.The prices were very reasonable.

reviews.title: Wonderful restaurant for lunch and dinner in a great place
reviews.text: we were taken to this restaurant during a visit to harlingen for lunch. the food was superb and the staff were really nice and made us feel very welcome. If you visit try the dutch mustard soup its fabulous. we were four for lunch and we could not praise the place enough. So we went back next day for evening meal which was equally as good, the fish on offer is superb, which it should be given harlingen is a port, you will not be disappointed.

reviews.title: Good
reviews.text: Good location, good service, tasty food. Very fresh seafood, nice wine card. Check is about 100€ for 3 person.

questions.content:

Do you show the soccer match  Germany vs. Slovakia on Sunday, June 26, 2016, 18 o'clock on TV?

articleContent.title: Your go-to guide for dog-friendly travel

seoInfo.metaDescription: Traveling with your dog has never been easier—or more fun. Cities across the country boast pet-friendly hotels, parks, and activities. With CESAR® brand’s mission to make the world more pet-friendly and Tripadvisor’s top-rated spots, you can plan with confidence. Whether it’s a quick getaway or a bucket-list trip, our guides help you stay, play, and explore with your pup. Grab the leash and go!

articleContent.title: A food lover’s guide to North Myrtle Beach

seoInfo.metaDescription: Whether it’s shoulder season or summer’s peak, you’ll always find delicious dishes at North Myrtle Beach. Dine by the waterfront after a balmy beach day, eat like the locals at treasured hotspots, or take the family out for a celebratory meal. Whatever you crave in an unforgettable vacation, you’re sure to find it here in this must-read roundup of top restaurants.

articleContent.title: A guide to sunny-day adventures in North Myrtle Beach

seoInfo.metaDescription: Craving sunshine and refreshing salt air? It’s easy to spend all day outside at North Myrtle Beach. From peaceful shores to exciting watersports, you’ll find plenty of reasons to stock up on sunscreen and take it all in.

articleContent.title: How to plan the perfect road trip in coastal Maine

seoInfo.metaDescription: Cory Lee takes us on an accessible tour of Acadia National Park, Ogunquit, and beyond.

articleContent.title: Eat your way around San Francisco

seoInfo.metaDescription: From a low-key burrito spot to an award-winning favorite, these are six San Francisco restaurants not to miss.

tripContent.title: Enter the unknown: Nevada’s wildest hidden realms
tripContent.description: Strange, surreal, and totally unforgettable, this is Nevada off the rails. From alien highways to haunted hotels, and from outdoor art playgrounds to eccentric ghost towns, this route is made for the curious traveler. Embrace the uncommon and uncover a different side of the Silver State, where ever stop feels like a secret waiting to be stumbled upon.

articleContent.title: Your guide to accessible travel around the world

seoInfo.metaDescription: Well-tested guidance and trip inspo from our community.

reviews.title: Good location
reviews.text: Nice drinks and food and a very pretty location on the inner Yaught harbour "Noorderhaven" in Harlingen.

reviews.title: dinner on the terrace
reviews.text: At 6.45 we had dinner along the canal. We both had chosen fish with rosé wine ... and a glass of water brought by the waiter to all tables.Service and food was good.

reviews.title: Good restaurant
reviews.text:
Very good value for money. 

Our steady pick, never been disappointed. 

From good vegetarian dishes to spare ribs. All good quality and quantity. 

A great collection of beer on draft.

reviews.title: Terrace Sun and Great Food and Drink!
reviews.text: A fabulous view of the Noorderhaven tall ships while enjoying a great menu and a wide selection of international drinks. The terrace is in a superb location to catch an all day sun while watching life in a historic sea port, pass by.

reviews.title: Disappointing food
reviews.text: Nice location, nice staff, but the food is appalling. Fish was not fresh at all, fries were everything but crispy. Tasteless. No idea how this restaurant got its good rating. There's plenty of alternative and better options around

reviews.title: Good place to go and right on the canal
reviews.text: We enjoyed our visit to t Noorderke & Noorderpoort. We enjoyed a number of Dutch appetizers for our meal complemented by good Dutch beer. The service was good with the waitstaff teaming up to take care of all tables together - this seemed pretty normal in Holland and something I think all countries could implement as it improved efficiency greatly! We liked being able to sit outside along the canal, but needed to go inside after awhile due to the weather getting a bit cold as the night came on. Definitely a good choice if visiting Harlingen.

photo.caption: Enjoying bitter ballen and a great local Harlingen beer

reviews.title: Lovely food, nice atmosphere
reviews.text: Popped in on a May evening whilst on a weekend break to the bar area rather than the restaurant. Simple menu bit the food was lovely, tasty, well cooked and presented. Medium cost and good value for money. Would return another day.

reviews.title: Fantastic Food
reviews.text: Delicious and fresh food, friendly and helpful personnel and good location. The time waiting is a bit more than expected, but this is easily forgotten once the fantastic meals arrive

reviews.title: Good
reviews.text: We had mussels and spare ribs. Excellent service and very friendly and helpful. Not sure this place is a solid 4 star, but based upon what we ordered it was definitely better than average.

reviews.title: Wait wait wait
reviews.text: If  you have all day then this is restaurant for you. I would like to be able to comment on the food but service was non existant. We had an hour until being picked up. We sat down ordered a drink which was delivered promptly.  We were reading the menu and waitress was going to  come back. Half hour later we went in and ordered another drink but did not hv time for food.  I guess they dont need the euros.  I just dont get it, there were only 4 occupied tables outside. If I owned a place like this I would think getting orders would be paramount to staying in business.

reviews.title: Delicious!
reviews.text: We had lunch on the terrace of t Noordeke and it could not have been better. We had the Sand Dabs and the Omelet and were both delighted with our choice. If we lived closer we would eat here once a week.

reviews.title: Delicious fresh fish in a cozy canal-side restaurant
reviews.text: Cafe 't Noorderke is a gem of a restaurant.  It's located near the harbor, overlooking the canal.  The decor is classic Dutch--old wood and antiques.  The staff were friendly, attentive, and helpful in explaining their range of beers and the varieties of fish (and other items) on the menu.  We had a great impression of the place before the food ever came.  Then the outstanding meal arrived and our estimation of the cafe zoomed over the top.  My husband had the slip tong (small-sized sole).  They brought him three of these delectably crisp fried fish, perfectly prepared and meaty.  I had the mixed grill of fresh Atlantic Cod, halibut, and zeewolf (I believe this is catfish).  The fish was cooked exactly right and was melt-in-the mouth fresh.  The sides were varied and delicious:  fried new potatoes, hot fennel slaw in a cream sauce, arugula salad, green beans bundled in ham, and a section of corn on the cob.  At 19 and 21 euros for our meals, the price was right too.  This was the best meal of our two week vacation.  Next time we're in The Netherlands, we'll happily make a detour to return to Harlingen and this restaurant.

reviews.title: Fantastic food, exploding with flavour
reviews.text:
We stumbled across this place while staying in the Crane in Harlingen Haven and decided to give it a go!   Best decision we could have made, the food was absolutely gorgeous.  Possibly one of the nicest meals I have had for quite a time. 

Its not a cheap venue but at about 70 euros for two adults with two courses its not the most expensive place in the world either.  It was worth every penny though as both starters and main courses were wonderful.  Goats cheese quiche with a raspberry  dressing, I've never tasted such an explosion of raspberry in my life!  and the Onion soup was amazing too.  The chef here clearly has a palate for flavour.

If you happen to be in this lovely little town I wouldn't hesitate at the door of this one.
